question: On a recent holiday, you lost a valuable item. Fortunately, you have travel insurance to cover the cost of anything lost.Write a letter to the manager of your insurance company. In your letter:describe the item you lostexplain how you lost ittell the insurance company what you would like them to do
text: I am writing to you regarding a loss of a laptop during a holiday. My insurance number is AA0012654.

Here is the description of the computer: it is Lenovo T1, 14 inches, black. The serial number is 18298ghgfh182. There were a few cartoon stickers on the front side, also it has a few shallow scratches. The original price of it was $1500.

I am pretty sure of the place I saw  last time. I was sitting at the loppy of a hotel, then I was distracted by a manager, she wanted me to sign some papers, that is why I left the laptop on the table and headed to the reception. It took me just a few minutes to deal with the documents, but when I returned, the laptop has gone.
Could you please inform me whether it is possible to compensate for the cost of the device? If my insurance covers such cases, could you please provide me with instructions on what I should do next?
